title: Social Cognitive Theory-Based Manual Wheelchair Training Design: Advanced Practitioner Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic rehabilitation science knowledge, wheelchair user assessment experience, and biomechanics understanding
context.additional_context: Learners perform team projects based on real clinical cases, implementing blended learning environments using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners will analyze wheelchair users' functional needs and design personalized training plans using a socio-cognitive theory framework.
Learners will develop wheelchair manipulation skill training simulations applying biomechanical principles and safety protocols.
Learners will create training effectiveness measurement tools at Kirkpatrick’s Level 2b (skill acquisition) using a PBL (Problem-Based Learning) approach.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
